resources.string: Expected the following name to appear:
There was the following name:
is not a variable or function name
"One or more arguments has an incorrect type when calling function "
"Either too few or two many arguments are being passed to function "
Can not call function
" , which is not defined."
Mismatched parentheses
Mismatched brackets
Mismatched begin - end construct
Unfinished begin - end construct
You forgot to complete the structure you started here
You forgot to close your parentheses
You forgot to close your brackets
You have an extra \'end\' in your program
IOException occurred while reading the input
Incomplete character literal
Missing file to include
You must close your quotes before starting a new line
Multiple definitions of main
Main program not found
Operator \"%1$s\" cannot be applied to arguments \"%2$s\" and \"%3$s\".\n One has type \"%4$s\" and the value has type \"%5$s\"
Operator \"%1$s\" is not a unary operator
Error while computing constant value: %1$s
Another name is expected before the end of this construct.
Expected the following name to appear: %1$s instead.\nThere was the following name: %2$s
Function declaration declares conflicting return type %1$s. It previously was defined as %2$s
Input stream not found exception
Can not find library %1$s
Main program not found
Definition of %1$s is not appropriate here: %2$s
Default Values can only be used when declaring variables one at a time.
Too many main programs are defined
Tried to do indexed access on something which wasn\'t an array or a string. It was a %1$s
The expression %1$s is not constant.
Array index must be integers: %1$s
%1$s is not a variable or function name
%1$s is not an instruction by itself.
Redefining function body for %1$s, which was previous define at %1$s
%1$s %2$s conflicts with previously defined %3$s with the same name defined at %4$s
The expression %1$s cannot have a value assigned to it.
The expression or variable %1$s is of type %2$s which cannot be %3$s converted to the type %4$s
The following name doesn\'t belong here: %1$s
Type %1$s is not defined.
Arithmetic Exception: %1$s
Script was manually terminated before it could finish executing
Wrong Args Exception
Wrong Type Input Exception
Pascal Arithmetic Exception
PascalArithmeticException
When calling Function or Procedure %1$s, the following java exception: %2$s
Pascal Arithmetic Exception
InternalInterpreterException
Attempting to use reflection when: %1$s
Zero Length Variable Exception
OrdinalExpressionExpectedException
Can not read variable of this type
1. An array was accessed with an index outside its declared range.\n 2. Trying to assign a value to a variable outside its range (for instance an enumerated type).
An error occurred when reading from disk. Typically happens when you try to read past the end of a file.
This is reported by Reset, Rewrite, Append, Rename and Erase, if you call them with an unassigned file as a parameter.
Reported when trying to erase, rename or open a non-existent file.
Reported by the following functions : Close, Read, Write, Seek, EOf, FilePos, FileSize, Flush, BlockRead, and BlockWrite if the file is not open.
Reported by Read, BlockRead, Eof, Eoln, SeekEof or SeekEoln if the file is not opened with Reset.
The application attempted to divide a number by zero.
Reported by the directory handling routines when a path does not exist or is invalid. Also reported when trying to access a non-existent file.

The maximum number of files currently opened by your process has been reached. Certain operating systems limit the number of files which can be opened concurrently, and this error can occur when this limit has been reached.

Permission to access the file is denied. This error might be caused by one of several reasons: - Trying to open for writing a file which is read-only, or which is actually a directory. - File is currently locked or used by another process. - Trying to create a new file, or directory while a file or directory of the same name already exists. - Trying to read from a file which was opened in write-only mode. - Trying to write from a file which was opened in read-only mode. - Trying to remove a directory or file while it is not possible. - No permission to access the file or directory.
Reported when a non-numeric value is read from a text file, and a numeric value was expected.
The stack has grown beyond its maximum size (in which case the size of local variables should be reduced to avoid this error), or the stack has become corrupt.
Can occur if you try to calculate the square root or logarithm of a negative number.
Value must be integers: %1$s
The value stored in a constant cannot be changed.
Operation not support
Stray character in program: %1$s\nChar code: %2$i
